title: CURL does not follow getaddrinfo sorting policy
body:
### I did this

On Linux one can define IPv6 or IPv4 preference by editing `/etc/gai.conf` and CURL will apply the defined policy.

```
label ::1/128       0    
label ::/0          1
label 2002::/16     2
label ::/96         3
label ::ffff:0:0/96 4
label fec0::/10     5
label fc00::/7      6
label 2001:0::/32   7
precedence  ::1/128       50
precedence  ::/0          40
precedence  2002::/16     30
precedence ::/96          20
precedence ::ffff:0:0/96  100
```

Result:

```
root@debian:~# curl my.ip.fi
87.138.*.*
```

On FreeBSD we can likewise set the policy:

```
root@freebsd:~ # service ip6addrctl status
Prefix                          Prec Label      Use
::1/128                           50     0        0
::/0                              40     1        7
::ffff:0.0.0.0/96                100     4        0
2002::/16                         30     2        0
2001::/32                          5     5        0
fc00::/7                           3    13        0
::/96                              1     3        0
fec0::/10                          1    11        0
3ffe::/16                          1    12        0
```

Result:

```
root@freebsd:~ # curl my.ip.fi
*:*:*:*:be24:11ff:fe60:a3df
```

So on FreeBSD CURL seems to prefer IPv6 unconditionally.

### I expected the following

CURL should prefer IPv4 if the address sorting policy is configured that way.
